intro: Leonohebe hectorii, commonly known as Hector's leonohebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
